page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: The area is primarily one of agriculture. The whole area is covered by farms which fall into three categories- those owned by farmers, tenant farmers and tenants of Shropshire County Council holdings. The latter are small units of, generally, less than 100 acres. In the last few years the population has risen as the village has become a commuter base although there are a number of Council houses in the area. Life Styles-page 2; Favourite Toys-page 3 (Patrina Hughes); Local Clubs- page 4;Religion-page 5; Entertainment-Holidays-page 6(Clare Broome); Housing -page 7; Employment and Transport-page 8; Farming - page 9 (Mark Yates);Farmhouses and Animals- page 10 (Anthony Hassall); Population page 11; Customs p.12; Education p.13; Home Life p.14.
